result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah M Hilleshiem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 225 sentence credit.  (If Probation was not revocated on Milwaukee County Case 13CF4987, then the sentence credit should be 353 days).

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid as follows:  $6,729.51 payable to Cindy S. and $3,973.17 to be paid to Inventix Manufacturing (defense is requesting a restitution hearing on this amount).  Restitution is to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the victim's family members listed in the criminal complaint, except to send a letter of apology to the victim's parents.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sarah M Hilleshiem in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Victim's aunt J.O. presented statements to the court.
Victim's aunt T.S. presented statements to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison: 7.5  Years.
Initial Confinement:  4.5  Years.
Extended Supervision: 3 Years.
225  Days Credit.  (if the probation was not revocation on Milwaukee County Case 13CF4987 then the credit shall be 353 days).

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim's family members listed in the criminal complaint except to send a letter of apoligy to the victim's parents.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Restitution:  $3,973.17 (to be paid to Inventix Manufacturing on case 14CF1197) - Defense is objecting to this amount and requesting a restitution hearing.

RESTITUTION:  $6,729.51 (to be paid to Cindy Shiltz - restitution to be paid before costs or fines) - Defense not objecting to this amount.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages).

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  






Count 2:
Total Prison: 5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2.5 Years.
Consecutive to:  Count 1
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
  

Term of Probation:  5 Years.
Consecutive to:  Count 1.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Same as Count 1 conditions of extended supervision.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages).


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to be transferred to Taycheedah Correctional - FORTHWITH.
Defendant can appear by Video Conferencing for the restitution hearing.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum filed by Atty Gaertner.
